description.narrative: Consolidation of the protected area system in the Qilian Mountains-Qinghai Lake landscape to conserve globally significant biodiversity and development of landscape management will promote resilience and a functional natural environment.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: Indicator 1: Number of direct project beneficiaries Indicator 2: Extent of PA sub-system expansion (including ecological corridors), with focus on increasing coverage of KBAs and improving habitat connectivity Indicator 3: Estimated populations of threatened species Indicator 4: Extent to which legal, policy and institutional frameworks reflect current national policy for biodiversity conservation Indicator 5: Institutional capacities for protected area management, as indicated in scores of the UNDP Capacity Development Scorecard Indicator 6: Sustainability of PA financing Indicator 7: Protected area management effectiveness score, as indicated by METT scores, for a. Qilian Mountains NRb. Qinghai Lake NNR Indicator 8: Threats to globally significant biodiversity at project demonstration sites reduced Indicator 9: Advances to collaborative PA governance, as indicated through Indicator 10: Effectiveness of project management Indicator 11: Extent of knowledge management Indicator 12: Level of knowledge, attitudes and practices (KAP) of target stakeholders, as measured by KAP surveys

comment.narrative: 1. to be verified during inception 2. Baseline area 2017: PA sub-system: 1,270,600 ha; Ecological corridors: none 3. a. Snow leopard camera-based detection rate 0.082 individuals/camera/month (2017 survey); b. Przewalski’s gazelle, 1,468 (2016 baseline) 4. There are gaps in current legal, policy and institutional frameworks, in terms of insufficient cross-sector collaboration, under-represented habitats within the PA system, fragmentation of the PA system, and key biodiversity areas (KBAs) not recognised in PA planning and management 5, 6. Please find in Prodoc p62 7. 31% for Qilian Mountains NR and 49% for Qinghai Lake NNR 8. Intervention areas will be defined in the pasture management plans developed for the target areas. 9. Terms of reference for PMO positions and PSC developed with clearly identified responsibilities 10. Resources have been allocated for assessing project results and preparing case studies, documenting lessons learned, and for participation in workshops, seminars and conferences. 11. Resources have been allocated for assessing project results and preparing case studies, documenting lessons learned, and for participation in workshops, seminars and conferences. 12. KAP framework outlined in Annex Q to the project document and includes target stakeholder groups and objectives of survey(s).

Output 1.1: Consolidated landscape conservation strategy and action plan, threatened species plans and PA sub-system regulations for the Qilian Mountains-Qinghai Lake landscape adopted and mainstreamed into the provincial 14th five-year plan (FYP) Output 1.2: Policies and guidelines developed for value-based allocations of eco-compensation funds, broader participation of the enterprise sector, and innovative financing mechanisms at the community level, strengthening the sustainability of PA financing Output1.3: Institutional enabling environment strengthened through introduction of PA competency-based professional development and joint capacity building for collaborative PA governance Output2.1: Operationalisation and expansion of the PA sub-system according to the consolidated landscape conservation strategy and action plan. Output2.2: Strengthened implementation capacities, coordination and partnerships across the Qilian Mountains-Qinghai Lake PA sub-system. Output2.3: Demonstrations of participatory habitat restoration and management arrangements within the expanded PA sub-system. Output2.4：Pilot interventions for sustainable livelihoods, enterprise sector involvement and conservation financing, improving community benefits and biodiversity threat reduction. Output3.1: Effective project management supported by proactive steering committee functions and inclusive monitoring & evaluation. Output3.2: Project results effectively shared through implementation of a targeted knowledge management action plan Output3.3：Inclusive participation of local communities, including women and ethnic minorities facilitated through effective implementation of environmental and social management framework

1. The project is considering integrating the landscape strategy action plan into the provincial significant ecological programme strategies, and following the recommendation made by MTR. By means of proper methods, both the project management effectiveness and the mainstreaming can be realized. 2. Sustainable financing specialist is developing the draft proposal of eco-compensation funds, innovative financing mechanisms of financing plan for PAs. 3. Beijing Fuqun Social Service Center has developed pilot eco-tourism implementation plans for four project demonstration villages. And the data showed that the net profit local households earned from the eco-tourism initiative are ranging from the 2,000 RMB to 20,000RMB in 2021. 4. 2021 project Capacity Building and Development Action Plan was developed and validated in June. By the end of November 2021, one of the project subcontractors has developed the Integrated Assessment System of Ecological Protection Staff Performance and Management, which will systematically guide the capacity building and development activities for local ecological protection staff in the Qilian Mountains Protected Area. 5. The application of Qinghai Lake National Park is in preparation. It will expand to five times as current 495,200ha Qinghai Lake National Nature Reserve. 6. The implementation capacity, coordination and partnership among stakeholders across the two areas were strengthened through a series of project activities including organizing workshops and meetings, joint holding public awareness raising campaigns, providing various training programs. 7. In Qinghai Lake region the Przewalski’s gazelle habitat, 137 ha pilot degraded grassland restored in participatory approach in June, including 130ha in Hudong Sheep Farm and 7ha in Dayu village. 8. In 2021 project Capacity Building and Development Action Plan, there are 3 training programs designed to pilot interventions for sustainable livelihoods, including excavator, electric welder and electrician vocational courses. 9. In 2021, several online meetings were organized focusing on ESMF and its progress. 10. Concrete outputs of project results like the Ecological Knowledge Reading Books for primary school student in the PAs, the Wolf & Bear Proof Pamphlet, etc. have been finished as project knowledge products, and widely shared in local areas. 11. The Project PSC members and other key stakeholders provided great support to the implementation of the project as well as the management arrangements, ensuring the smooth and effective delivery of project outputs and results.

Activity 1.1: Consolidated landscape conservation strategy and action plan, threatened species plans and PA sub-system regulations for the Qilian Mountains-Qinghai Lake landscape adopted and mainstreamed into the provincial 14th five-year plan (FYP) Activity 1.2: Develop policies and guidelines for value-based allocations of eco-compensation funds, broader participation of the enterprise sector, and innovative financing mechanisms at the community level, strengthening the sustainability of PA financing Activity 1.3: Institutional enabling environment strengthened through introduction of PA competency-based professional development and joint capacity building for collaborative PA governance Activity 2.1: Output 2.1: Operationalisation and expansion of the PA sub-system according to the consolidated landscape conservation strategy and action plan Activity2.2: Strengthened implementation capacities, coordination and partnerships across the Qilian Mountains-Qilian Lake PA sub-system Activity 2.3: Demonstrations of participatory habitat restoration and management arrangements within the expanded PA sub-system Activity2.4 Pilot interventions for sustainable livelihoods, enterprise sector involvement and conservation financing, improving community benefits and biodiversity threat reduction Activity 3.1: Inclusive participation of local communities, including women and ethnic minorities facilitated through effective implementation of environmental and social management framework Activity 3.2: Project results effectively shared through implementation of a targeted knowledge management action plan Activity 3.3: Inclusive participation of local communities, including women and ethnic minorities facilitated through effective implementation of environmental and social management framework

By September, the project implementation system from PMO and coordination office at provincial level to project offices at county, township level and 7 co-management committees at village level had been established.80 sets of solar battery and office furniture purchased by PMO were equipped to demonstration villages. Patrolling and monitoring equipment such as infra-triggered cameras, patrol terminals and etc. were equipped to key agencies. All the Przewalskis gazelle’s populations were under monitoring now.
5 specialists were recruited. 6 technical services like pasture management, gap analysis etc. were subcontracted to 6 institutions via open tendering. To improve Przewalskis gazelle’s habitat, 100,000 meters fences were lowered. 154 tons of forage grass were distributed in case of food shortage in winter.
Biodiversity conservation campaign was held to public at Xining CBD plaza. Across Qinghai province,33 rounds of volunteer initiative activities were conducted and over 12,700 school students received environmental education, which is a breakthrough in local history. 26 seminars, workshops and meetings were held in 2019, with 849 participants, including 306 females, accounting for 36%. A woman group for alternative livelihood has conducted the first tour of embroidery Huzhu and Huangzhong county.
The GEF budget for 2019 is USD 252113.5, with expenditure accounting to USD75,539. The project delivery rate is 30% (exchange rate: 7.0). Qinghai Finance Department’s co-financing budget for 2019 is RMB 3,000,000, with full expenditure completed.

Output 1.1: Consolidated landscape conservation strategy and action plan, threatened species plans and PA sub-system regulations for the Qilian Mountains-Qinghai Lake landscape adopted and mainstreamed into the provincial 14th five-year plan (FYP) Output 1.2: Policies and guidelines developed for value-based allocations of eco-compensation funds, broader participation of the enterprise sector, and innovative financing mechanisms at the community level, strengthening the sustainability of PA financing Output1.3: Institutional enabling environment strengthened through introduction of PA competency-based professional development and joint capacity building for collaborative PA governance Output2.1: Operationalisation and expansion of the PA sub-system according to the consolidated landscape conservation strategy and action plan. Output2.2: Strengthened implementation capacities, coordination and partnerships across the Qilian Mountains-Qinghai Lake PA sub-system. Output2.3: Demonstrations of participatory habitat restoration and management arrangements within the expanded PA sub-system. Output2.4：Pilot interventions for sustainable livelihoods, enterprise sector involvement and conservation financing, improving community benefits and biodiversity threat reduction. Output3.1: Effective project management supported by proactive steering committee functions and inclusive monitoring & evaluation. Output3.2: Project results effectively shared through implementation of a targeted knowledge management action plan Output3.3：Inclusive participation of local communities, including women and ethnic minorities facilitated through effective implementation of environmental and social management framework

In 2020, six indicative activities were implemented against the Output 1.1 including strategic mainstreaming group meeting, legislation consulting group meeting, gap analysis, review of conservation plans for snow leopard and Przewalski’s gazelle, the initial assessment report of Qinghai biodiversity laws and regulations was completed and the report was submitted. The 14th FYP Strategic Engagement (mainstreaming) Consulting Group and the Law and Enforcement Task Force both were established in May to guide and provide consultancy to specific activities; the GAP analysis was completed, the report of it was reviewed and the conclusion as well as the conservation recommendations were accepted by local collaborative organizations. The snow leopard conservation plan and the Przewaski’s gazelle conservation plan were developed by Qinghai Forestry and Grassland Bureau and the project provide supports on the review of the two plans. Recommendations and results of the two plans were widely shared with the agencies related to the conservation of the two species across the province.
